title: Systems metabolic insights into kaempferol-mediated alleviation of alcoholic fatty liver disease.
abstract: Alcoholic fatty liver disease (AFLD) is a significant global health concern caused by chronic and excessive alcohol consumption, leading to hepatic steatosis, inflammation, and metabolic disruption. Currently, there are limited effective therapeutic options. Kaempferol, a dietary flavonoid, has shown potential for regulating oxidative stress and lipid metabolism.
